page.title: 02FARMING
page.content: One of the major sources of income in the area about Golden Cross is agriculture. There is no other large industry in the area and no factories. The farming consists of a number of small intensive farms owned by the farmers and are mainly arable farms. The major crops that are grown are wheat and barley, with some corn grown in small patches. A company wanting to buy the crop will send a buyer to inspect the grain and pay for it. The company will send a truck for it, thus lowering costs for the farmer. Some of the farms are mixed arable and also raise cattle.The cows are sold for meat once a year in the nearby market of Hailsham and Lewes. There are no pastoral farms and those that have cattle do it as a sideline to crops.
